xxl.core.relational.cursors
Class SortMergeJoin

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor<E>
      xxl.core.cursors.joins.SortMergeJoin<Tuple,Tuple>
          xxl.core.relational.cursors.SortMergeJoin
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterator<Tuple>, Cursor<Tuple>, MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Orenstein
public class SortMergeJoin
extends SortMergeJoin<Tuple,Tuple>
implements MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>

This class realizes a join operator based on the sort-merge paradigm. The two input relations have to be sorted. The algorithm of SortMergeJoin is used internally.

There are easy-to-use constructors and others, that need more knowledge about the class SweepArea. Note: tuples can only find join partners in a sweep-area. So, thepredicate and the comparator have to be chosen carefully!

Compared to NestedLoopsJoin this class does not directly support a Cartesian product.

Constructor Detail

SortMergeJoin

public SortMergeJoin(MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> sortedCursor1,
                     MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> sortedCursor2,
                     MergedResultSetMetaData metaData,
                     SweepArea<Tuple> sweepArea1,
                     SweepArea<Tuple> sweepArea2,
                     Comparator<? super Tuple> comparator,
                     Function<Object,? extends Tuple> createTuple,
                     SortMergeJoin.Type type)
Advanced constructor for a new sort-merge join.

Handle with care! Do not use this constructor if you do not know exactly what you are doing.

Parameters:
sortedCursor1 - the input metadata cursor delivering the elements of the first relation.
sortedCursor2 - the input metadata cursor delivering the elements of the second relation.
metaData - the relational metadata of the new sort-merge join.
sweepArea1 - the first sweep-area.
sweepArea2 - the second sweep-area.
comparator - a comparator that gets an object from every input relation and determines, which tuple has to be inserted into the sweep-area first.
createTuple - a function that maps a list of objects (column values) to a new result tuple. ArrayTuple.FACTORY_METHOD can be used.
type - the type of the join operation. Possible values are the elements of the enumeration defined above in this class.

SortMergeJoin

public SortMergeJoin(MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> sortedCursor1,
                     MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> sortedCursor2,
                     MetaDataPredicate<? super Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> theta,
                     SweepArea<Tuple> sweepArea1,
                     SweepArea<Tuple> sweepArea2,
                     Comparator<? super Tuple> comparator,
                     Function<Object,? extends Tuple> createTuple,
                     SortMergeJoin.Type type)
Constructs a new sort-merge join.

The metadata predicate is used to provide the right join metadata! It is NOT automatically used in the given sweep-areas. This has to be done explicitely by the developer who specifies the sweep-areas.

Parameters:
sortedCursor1 - the input metadata cursor delivering the elements of the first relation.
sortedCursor2 - the input metadata cursor delivering the elements of the second relation.
theta - a metadata predicate that determines if two tuples qualify for the result. This predicate has to provide the relational metadata for the new sort-merge join.
sweepArea1 - the first sweep-area.
sweepArea2 - the second sweep-area.
comparator - a comparator that gets an object from every input relation and determines, which tuple has to be inserted into the sweep-area first.
createTuple - a function that maps a list of objects (column values) to a new result tuple. ArrayTuple.FACTORY_METHOD can be used.
type - the type of the join operation. Possible values are the elements of the enumeration defined above in this class.

SortMergeJoin

public SortMergeJoin(MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> sortedCursor1,
                     MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> sortedCursor2,
                     MetaDataPredicate<? super Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> theta,
                     Function<?,? extends Bag<Tuple>> newBag,
                     Comparator<? super Tuple> comparator,
                     Function<Object,? extends Tuple> createTuple,
                     SortMergeJoin.Type type)
Constructs a new sort-merge join.

The metadata predicate is used to provide the right join metadata AND is automatically used in the required sweep-areas.

Parameters:
sortedCursor1 - the input metadata cursor delivering the elements of the first relation.
sortedCursor2 - the input metadata cursor delivering the elements of the second relation.
theta - a metadata predicate that determines if two tuples qualify for the result. This predicate has to provide the relational metadata for the new sort-merge join.
newBag - a factory method returning a bag that is used inside a sweep-area. Both sweep-areas are instances of the inner class SortMergeJoin.PredicateBasedSA defined above.
comparator - a comparator that gets an object from every input relation and determines, which tuple has to be inserted into the sweep-area first.
createTuple - a function that maps a list of objects (column values) to a new result tuple. ArrayTuple.FACTORY_METHOD can be used.
type - the type of the join operation. Possible values are the elements of the enumeration defined above in this class.

SortMergeJoin

public SortMergeJoin(MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> sortedCursor1,
                     MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> sortedCursor2,
                     Predicate<? super Tuple> theta,
                     Function<?,? extends Bag<Tuple>> newBag,
                     Comparator<? super Tuple> comparator,
                     Function<Object,? extends Tuple> createTuple,
                     SortMergeJoin.Type type)
Constructs a new sort-merge join.

The predicate is automatically used in the required sweep-areas. The relational metadata is calculated from the relational metadata of the input cursors involving the join operator's type.

Parameters:
sortedCursor1 - the input metadata cursor delivering the elements of the first relation.
sortedCursor2 - the input metadata cursor delivering the elements of the second relation.
theta - a predicate that determines if two tuples qualify for the result.
newBag - a factory method returning a bag that is used inside a sweep-area. Both sweep-areas are instances of the inner class SortMergeJoin.PredicateBasedSA defined above.
comparator - a comparator that gets an object from every input relation and determines, which tuple has to be inserted into the sweep-area first.
createTuple - a function that maps a list of objects (column values) to a new result tuple. ArrayTuple.FACTORY_METHOD can be used.
type - the type of the join operation. Possible values are the elements of the enumeration defined above in this class.

                                                               SortMergeJoin.Type type)
                                                        throws IllegalArgumentException
An internal static method computing the relational metadata for all types of joins except theta joins.

Parameters:
sortedCursor1 - the input metadata cursor delivering the elements of the first relation.
sortedCursor2 - the input metadata cursor delivering the elements of the second relation.
type - the type of the join operation. Possible values are the elements of the enumeration defined above in this class.
Returns:
relational metadata that is appropriate for the type of join.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if an unsupported join type is given.
